text:
Ninth Avenue, east side, at 27th Street.
June 28, 1928.
P. L. Sperr, Photographer.

Ninth Avenue, from W. 27th to 28th Streets, as viewed across the easterly portion of Chelsea Park from the roof of No. 424 W. 27th Street. The P. E. Church of the Holy Apostles is at the S. E. corner of 28th Street.

March 24, 1929
Views 1,2

P. L. Sperr

Ninth Avenue, from W. 27th to 28th Streets, as viewed across the easterly portion of Chelsea Park from the roof of No. 424 W. 27th Street. The P. E. Church of the Holy Apostles is at the S. E. corner of 28th Street.

March 24, 1929
Views 1,2

P. L. Sperr

(1)
Ninth Avenue, Westside looking north from North east corner of 27th Street. Large building at the North West corner of 29th S Street is the Parcel Post office under construction in 1932. Shows also a corner of the Chelsea Park.

(2)
Same.

(1)
Ninth Avenue, Westside looking north from North east corner of 27th Street. Large building at the North West corner of 29th S Street is the Parcel Post office under construction in 1932. Shows also a corner of the Chelsea Park.

(2)
Same.

Ninth Avenue, west side, north from W. 27th Street, showing the easterly side of Chelsea Park, the Public Bath (at No. 407-13 W. 28th Street), the new steel structure of the Post Office's Parcel Post Office and the Ninth Avenue "El." The park occupies the entire block between Ninth and Tenth Avenues, extending from 27th to 28th Streets.

View 2 shows only the area between W. 28th and 30th Streets of which the second block is entirely occupied by the rising Post Office building.

May 15, 1932
View: 1-2

P. L. Sperr

Ninth Avenue, west side, north from W. 27th Street, showing the easterly side of Chelsea Park, the Public Bath (at No. 407-13 W. 28th Street), the new steel structure of the Post Office's Parcel Post Office and the Ninth Avenue "El." The park occupies the entire block between Ninth and Tenth Avenues, extending from 27th to 28th Streets.

View 2 shows only the area between W. 28th and 30th Streets of which the second block is entirely occupied by the rising Post Office building.

May 15, 1932
View: 1-2

P. L. Sperr

428-432 West 27th Street, south side, between Ninth and Tenth Avenues. No. 430 is a three-story frame building.

1932.

J. Clarence Davies Collection, Museum of the City of New York. Negative No. 136.

430 West 27th Street, south side, between Ninth and Tenth Aves. Building concerned is a 3-story frame house.

July 21, 1934.

P. L. Sperr.

Chelsea Park: A partial view of the southerly side of same as photographed on West 27th Street. This open area occupies the block of 27th -28th Streets between 9th & 10th Avenues and has P. S. No. 33 therein. The extra-curricular activities are under the auspices of the Hudson Guild. A free milk station operated by them is shown to the rear of the school structure.

The spire of the P. E. Church of the Holy Apostles appears across the trees at the east end and though seeming to be amid same is not. This is on the opposite side of 9th Avenue (El. line there upon), at the S. E. corner of 28th Street. Beyond is the towering Empire State Building.

P. L. Sperr

July 21, 1934
Views 1, 2, 3

Chelsea Park: A partial view of the southerly side of same as photographed on West 27th Street. This open area occupies the block of 27th -28th Streets between 9th & 10th Avenues and has P. S. No. 33 therein. The extra-curricular activities are under the auspices of the Hudson Guild. A free milk station operated by them is shown to the rear of the school structure.

The spire of the P. E. Church of the Holy Apostles appears across the trees at the east end and though seeming to be amid same is not. This is on the opposite side of 9th Avenue (El. line there upon), at the S. E. corner of 28th Street. Beyond is the towering Empire State Building.

P. L. Sperr

July 21, 1934
Views 1, 2, 3

Chelsea Park: A partial view of the southerly side of same as photographed on West 27th Street. This open area occupies the block of 27th -28th Streets between 9th & 10th Avenues and has P. S. No. 33 therein. The extra-curricular activities are under the auspices of the Hudson Guild. A free milk station operated by them is shown to the rear of the school structure.

The spire of the P. E. Church of the Holy Apostles appears across the trees at the east end and though seeming to be amid same is not. This is on the opposite side of 9th Avenue (El. line there upon), at the S. E. corner of 28th Street. Beyond is the towering Empire State Building.

P. L. Sperr

July 21, 1934
Views 1, 2, 3

Chelsea Park, looking towards Ninth Avenue from the 27th Street side. The Protestant Episcopal Church of the Holy Apostles stands on the S.E. corner of Ninth Avenue and 28th Street. July 21, 1934.

P. L. Sperr.

Chelsea Park: A set of 3 views, northeastward from various points on West 27th Street between Ninth and Tenth Avenues, showing the rear of Public School No. 33 and a Public Health Station, both located in the easterly half of this park. Across same appears the town of the Empire State Bldg. and the spire of the P.E. Church of the Holy Apostles; the latter is located at the S.E. corner of Ninth Avenue and W. 28th street and has a very interesting history, being representative of a single individuals tenacity of purpose and the reward thereof.
In 1937 the Board of Education proposed to erect a new school here to replace that shown, but decided not to. Note the 1 story free milk station seen in the foreground.

P. L. Sperr.

August 4, 1938.
Views 1, 2 and 3.

Chelsea Park: A set of 3 views, northeastward from various points on West 27th Street between Ninth and Tenth Avenues, showing the rear of Public School No. 33 and a Public Health Station, both located in the easterly half of this park.
